  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractBinNode<T>

extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • value

        protected T extends java.lang.Comparable<T> value
        The payload wrapped by the current node. This reference might be null.

      • sibling

        protected BinNode<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> sibling
        The next sibling of the current node. This reference is null if the current node is the last ("rightmost") node.

      • child

        protected BinNode<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> child
        The first ("leftmost") child, i.e. the head of the linked list comprising all the children of the current node. This reference is null if the current node is a leaf (with no children).

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBinNode

        public AbstractBinNode(T value,
               BinNode<T> sibling,
               BinNode<T> child)

    • Method Detail

      • isTree

        public abstract boolean isTree()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal general tree.
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of a tree; false otherwise (e.g. in the case of a DAG).
        See Also:
        Arborescence, Out-Tree

      • getHeight

        public abstract int getHeight()
        Computes the height of the current node in the tree, if this is the root of a legal tree.
        Returns:
        • -1 if the current node is not the root of a legal tree
        • 0 if the current node is a leaf
        • its height in the tree otherwise
        See Also:
        Terminology: Height of node, isTree()

      • getBranchingFactor

        public abstract int getBranchingFactor()
        Computes the maximum branching factor of the tree with the current node as root, if this is the root of a legal tree.
        Returns:
        • -1 if the current node is not the root of a legal tree
        • the maximum degree of the current tree and all its subtrees otherwise
        See Also:
        Terminology: Degree, Branching factor, isTree()

      • isBinaryTree

        public abstract boolean isBinaryTree()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal binary tree. The root itself must not have any siblings, but any other node in the subtrees may have at most one sibling.
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of a binary tree; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Binary tree, isTree()

      • isBinarySearchTree

        public abstract boolean isBinarySearchTree()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal binary search tree, i.e.
        • if the current tree is a binary tree
        • and the values in the tree are sorted according to their natural ordering (see Comparable)
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of a binary search tree; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Binary search tree, isBinaryTree(), Comparable

      • isAVLTree

        public abstract boolean isAVLTree()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal AVL tree, i.e. if the current tree is a balanced binary search tree.
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of an AVL tree; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        AVL tree, isBinarySearchTree(), getHeight()

      • isMinHeap

        public abstract boolean isMinHeap()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal Minheap satisfying the shape and the heap properties and having the smallest value in this (root) node.
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of an Minheap; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Binary heap, Comparable

      • isMaxHeap

        public abstract boolean isMaxHeap()
        Checks if the current node is the root of a legal Maxheap satisfying the shape and the heap properties and having the greatest value in this (root) node.
        Returns:
        true if the current node is the root of an Maxheap; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Binary heap, Comparable

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the current node and its descendants using the Newick tree format. If the current node and its descendants represent a cyclic structure, then this method will not terminate (or probably end up with a StackOverflowError).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the current node and its descendants using the Newick tree format.
        See Also:
        Newick notation
